raw_text: (Shen and Lapata, 2007) has shown that shallow semantic information in the form of predicate argument structures (PASs) improves the automatic detection of correct answers to a target question
clean_text: (Shen and Lapata, 2007) has shown that shallow semantic information in the form of predicate argument structures (PASs) improves the automatic detection of correct answers to a target question.

citing_paper_authors: Marco, Pennacchiotti | Diego, de Cao | Roberto, Basili | Danilo, Croce | Michael, Roth
raw_text: For example, Shen and Lapata (2007) show the potential improvement thatFrameNet can bring on the performance of a Question Answering (QA) system
clean_text: For example, Shen and Lapata (2007) show the potential improvement that FrameNet can bring on the performance of a Question Answering (QA) system.

citing_paper_authors: Stephen, Wan | Mark, Dras | Robert, Dale | Cécile L., Paris
raw_text: The alignment of answers to question types as a semantic role labelling task using similar methods was explored by Shen and Lapata (2007)
clean_text: The alignment of answers to question types as a semantic role labelling task using similar methods was explored by Shen and Lapata (2007).

citing_paper_authors: Josef, Ruppenhofer | Caroline, Sporleder | Roser, Morante | Collin F., Baker | Martha, Palmer
raw_text: The state-of-the-art in semantic role labelling has now advanced so much that a number of studies have shown that automatically inferred semantic argument structure scan lead to tangible performance gains in NLPapplications such as information extraction (Surdeanu et al, 2003), question answering (Shen and Lapata, 2007) or recognising textual entailment (Burchardt and Frank, 2006)
clean_text: The state-of-the-art in semantic role labelling has now advanced so much that a number of studies have shown that automatically inferred semantic argument structures can lead to tangible performance gains in NLP applications such as information extraction (Surdeanu et al, 2003), question answering (Shen and Lapata, 2007) or recognising textual entailment (Burchardt and Frank, 2006).

citing_paper_authors: Ekaterina, Ovchinnikova | Niloofar, Montazeri | Theodore, Alexandrov | Jerry R., Hobbs | Michael C., McCord | Rutu, Mulkar
raw_text: FrameNet has a shorter history in NLP applications thanWordNet, but lately more and more researchers have been demonstrating its potential to improve the quality of question answering (Shen and Lapata, 2007) and recognizing textual entailment (Burchardt et al, 2009)
clean_text: FrameNet has a shorter history in NLP applications than WordNet, but lately more and more researchers have been demonstrating its potential to improve the quality of question answering (Shen and Lapata, 2007) and recognizing textual entailment (Burchardt et al, 2009).

citing_paper_authors: Hirotoshi, Taira | Sanae, Fujita | Masaaki, Nagata
raw_text: Recently, predicate argument structure analysis has attracted the attention of researchers because this information can increase the precision of text processing tasks, such as machine translation ,information extraction (Hirschman et al, 1999), question answering (Narayanan and Harabagiu, 2004) (Shen and Lapata, 2007), and summarization (Melli et al., 2005)
clean_text: Recently, predicate argument structure analysis has attracted the attention of researchers because this information can increase the precision of text processing tasks, such as machine translation, information extraction (Hirschman et al, 1999), question answering (Narayanan and Harabagiu, 2004) (Shen and Lapata, 2007), and summarization (Melli et al., 2005).

citing_paper_authors: Luiz Augusto, Pizzato | Diego, Molla Aliod
raw_text: Shen and Lapata (2007) developed an answer extraction module that incorporates FrameNet style semantic role information
clean_text: Shen and Lapata (2007) developed an answer extraction module that incorporates FrameNet style semantic role information.

raw_text: Indeed, the analysis produced by existing semantic role labelers has been shown to benefit awide spectrum of applications ranging from information extraction (Surdeanu et al, 2003) and question answering (Shen and Lapata, 2007), to machine translation (Wu and Fung, 2009) and summarization (Melli et al, 2005)
clean_text: Indeed, the analysis produced by existing semantic role labelers has been shown to benefit a wide spectrum of applications ranging from information extraction (Surdeanu et al, 2003) and question answering (Shen and Lapata, 2007), to machine translation (Wu and Fung, 2009) and summarization (Melli et al, 2005).

citing_paper_authors: Diego, de Cao | Danilo, Croce | Marco, Pennacchiotti | Roberto, Basili
raw_text: Recent studies (e.g. Shen and Lapata (2007)) show that the use of FrameNet can potentially improve the performance of QuestionAnswering systems
clean_text: Recent studies (e.g. Shen and Lapata (2007)) show that the use of FrameNet can potentially improve the performance of Question Answering systems.

citing_paper_authors: Diego, de Cao | Danilo, Croce | Marco, Pennacchiotti | Roberto, Basili
raw_text: Yet, Shen and Lapata (2007) also point out that the low coverage of the current version of FrameNet significantly limits the expected boost in performance
clean_text: Yet, Shen and Lapata (2007) also point out that the low coverage of the current version of FrameNet significantly limits the expected boost in performance.

citing_paper_authors: Tingxu, Yan | Tamsin, Maxwell | Dawei, Song | Yuexian, Hou | Peng, Zhang
raw_text: Compared to the MRF model, our approach is unsupervised where MRFs require the training of parameters using relevance judgments that are often unavailable in practical conditions. Other work incorporating syntactic and linguistic information into IR includes early research by (Smeaton, O? Donnell and Kelledy, 1995), who employed tree structured analytics (TSAs) resembling dependency trees, the use of syntax to detect paraphrases for question answering (QA) (Lin and Pantel, 2001), and semantic role labelling in QA (Shen and Lapata, 2007)
clean_text: Other work incorporating syntactic and linguistic information into IR includes early research by (Smeaton, O Donnell and Kelledy, 1995), who employed tree structured analytics (TSAs) resembling dependency trees, the use of syntax to detect paraphrases for question answering (QA) (Lin and Pantel, 2001), and semantic role labelling in QA (Shen and Lapata, 2007).

raw_text: 1320mantic role analysis has the potential of benefiting awide spectrum of applications ranging from information extraction (Surdeanu et al, 2003) and question answering (Shen and Lapata, 2007), to machine translation (Wu and Fung, 2009) and summarization (Melli et al, 2005)
clean_text: Semantic role analysis has the potential of benefiting a wide spectrum of applications ranging from information extraction (Surdeanu et al, 2003) and question answering (Shen and Lapata, 2007), to machine translation (Wu and Fung, 2009) and summarization (Melli et al, 2005).

raw_text: In particular, resources annotated with the surface realization of semantic roles, like FrameNet (Baker et al, 1998) or PropBank (Palmeret al, 2005) have shown to convey an improvement in several NLP tasks, from question answering (Shen and Lapata, 2007) to textual entailment (Burchardt et al, 2007) and shallow semantic parsing (Giuglea and Moschitti, 2006)
clean_text: In particular, resources annotated with the surface realization of semantic roles, like FrameNet (Baker et al, 1998) or PropBank (Palmeret al, 2005) have shown to convey an improvement in several NLP tasks, from question answering (Shen and Lapata, 2007) to textual entailment (Burchardt et al, 2007) and shallow semantic parsing (Giuglea and Moschitti, 2006).
